meanings.definition: A mineral consisting of iron disulfide, typically occurring as brassy-yellow cubic crystals.
meanings.sent1: The geologist found a shiny piece of pyrites during the excavation.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a beautiful collection of pyrites from different regions.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome used pyrites to trick his friends into thinking he found gold.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the cave like the glint of pyrites in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight reflected off the pyrites, creating a dazzling display of colors.

meanings.definition: A substance that produces sparks when struck against steel, used in early firearms.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith carefully placed the pyrites next to the flint to start the fire.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, soldiers relied on pyrites to ignite their muskets in battle.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain grinned mischievously as he struck the pyrites to light the cannon.
meanings.sent4: Her determination sparked like the pyrites, igniting a fire within her to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The pyrites glowed brightly as it created a shower of sparks when struck against the steel.
